articles.description: Follow BBC Radio 5 Live commentary and text updates of the Rugby World Cup final between New Zealand and South Africa.
articles.title: Rugby World Cup final: New Zealand v South Africa build-up

articles.description: Eddie Nketiah scores his first Premier League hat-trick as Arsenal extend their unbeaten start to the season with victory over Sheffield United.
articles.title: Nketiah scores hat-trick as Arsenal thump Sheff Utd

articles.description: Complaints about the pitch, ruck speed, officiating and suggestions the visitors threw away the first Test added spice to second Test, which England won.
articles.title: Tonga comments gave England 'massive motivation'

articles.description: Hwang Hee-chan concedes a penalty and scores an equaliser as Wolves draw with Newcastle United to extend their Premier League unbeaten run to five matches
articles.title: Newcastle held to draw after Wolves comeback

articles.description: Watch highlights as Australia beat New Zealand on the last ball in the highest-scoring game in Cricket World Cup history.
articles.title: Australia edge New Zealand in record-breaking thriller

articles.description: Jude Bellingham scores a fabulous equaliser and a 92nd-minute winner to help Real Madrid come from behind to beat rivals Barcelona.
articles.title: Bellingham double seals dramatic Real win over Barca

articles.description: Follow live text and audio commentary from final practice and qualifying at the Mexico City Grand Prix.
articles.title: Mexico City Grand Prix final practice - radio & text

articles.description: Australia were underestimated coming into the Cricket World Cup, but they are starting to become a dangerous prospect as they near a semi-final spot.
articles.title: 'Underestimated Australia are dangerous prospect'

articles.description: Glenn Maxwell hits the biggest six of the World Cup so far, hitting a stand roof, as Australia pile on the runs against New Zealand.
articles.title: Maxwell hits roof with biggest six of World Cup

articles.description: Celtic lacked "speed and tempo" in missing the chance to move 10 points clear at the top of the Scottish Premiership, says Brendan Rodgers.
articles.title: Celtic 'lacked speed and tempo' in Hibernian draw
